      This is to check that an error occurs properly when the frequency is too high for the Note to process.

      This will test to see if the note constructor handles incorrect octaves being given.

      This will test to see if the note constructor handles 'E' sharps being incorrect.

      This will test to see if the modifyNoteByHalfSteps is properly adding the appropriate amount from the note.

      This will test to see if the modifyNoteByHalfSteps is properly throwing an error when attempting to subtract too much.

      void NoteTest.testModifyHalfNotesSubtractionError()
      This will test to see if the modifyNoteByHalfSteps is properly throwing an error when attempting to add too much.

    • Uses of InvalidNoteException in utilities

      Methods in utilities that throw InvalidNoteException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void NoteADT.midiNoteValueCheck(int midiValue)
      Observer method that checks the midi notes calculated value and throws an exception if the midi value is too high or too low.
      abstract void NoteADT.modifyNoteByHalfSteps(int numberOfHalfSteps)
      Mutator method that raises or lowers the pitch (note) by any number of half steps.
      Constructors in utilities that throw InvalidNoteException 
      Constructor and Description
      NoteADT(double frequency)
      Constructor for a note that accepts a frequency as a double (Hz).
      NoteADT(int halfSteps)
      Constructor for a note that accepts a number of half steps as an integer.
      NoteADT(java.lang.String stringNote)
      The constructors for a note that accepts a String representation of a note such as C#4 A note that its MIDI value is outside the range of 0 - 127 is an invalid note and the InvalidNoteException is raised.
